Name: CFPB Rule Means No More Medical Debt on Credit Scores
Summary: ‍Starting March 2025, medical bills will no longer impact your credit ...
Body:
For millions of Americans struggling with medical debt, relief is on the horizon. Starting March 2025, medical bills will no longer cast a shadow over your credit score

Why This Matters

  • ‍$49 Billion Gone: About 15 million Americans will see medical debt disappear from credit reports.‍
  • More Opportunities: This change could lead to 22,000 more mortgage approvals every year.‍
  • Better Lending Decisions: Medical debt isn't a good predictor of whether someone will repay loans, so it's out!

Key Details

This doesn't mean your medical bills vanish. You're still responsible for paying them—just without the extra pressure on your credit.

What Can You Do?

  • Check your credit report regularly for updates
  • Dispute any inaccurate bills with tools like DebtCat
  • Negotiate payment plans directly with providers

This CFPB rule is a big step toward fairer lending and fewer sleepless nights over medical debt. Stay ahead by understanding your rights and using resources to manage your debt.
Author: team-debtcat

Name: California Removes Medical Debt from Credit Reports in 2025
Summary: A new law (SB 1061) will eliminate medical debt from credit reports
Body: Struggling with medical debt in California? Starting January 1, 2025, a new law (SB 1061) will eliminate medical debt from credit reports, offering financial relief and potentially boosting your credit score.
Author: team-debtcat

Name: Debt Collector vs. Credit Bureau
Summary: Dispute Options: Collectors vs Credit Bureaus
Body: Are you drowning in calls from debt collectors for money you don't owe? You're not alone. Millions of Americans face this nightmare every year. But here's the good news: you have powerful tools to fight back. Let's break down your options and create an action plan to reclaim your financial peace of mind.

Name: Debt Collectors Beware
Summary: Understanding your rights under the FDCPA and CFPB can protect you.
Body: Debt collectors violate federal law in one out of every seven interactions. That's right - your odds of facing illegal practices are higher than you might think. But don't panic - understanding your rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA) and Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) can shield you from these abuses and keep your finances safe.

Name: Debt Consolidation Secrets
Summary: Understand what debt consolidation is, how it works, and its potential risks and benefits.
Body: Are you drowning in multiple debt payments each month? Imagine a single bill instead of a stack of overdue notices. Before you jump into debt consolidation, learn what banks and lenders don't tell you about this common debt relief option. This comprehensive guide reveals the real costs and better alternatives for your financial freedom.

Name: Debt Negotiation: An Insider's Guide
Summary: Knowing your rights and how to handle the situation can make a significant difference.
Body: Dealing with debt collectors can be an overwhelming experience, but you're not alone in this journey. By understanding your rights and exploring your options, you can negotiate your debt down to a more manageable amount—even if making payments feels challenging right now.

Name: Old Debt Calls?
Summary: What the Statute of Limitations Means for You
Body: Debt collectors calling about ancient bills? You're not alone, and you've got more power than you think. Let's dive into how the statute of limitations can be your financial shield.
Author: team-debtcat

Name: What Really Happens When You Ignore Debt?
Summary: The risks of ignoring debt and why it's crucial to tackle it head-on.
Body: We've all been there—that moment when the bills are stacking up, and a little voice whispers, What if I just… ignore these for a while?" We understand how overwhelming debt can feel. Taking a step back might seem like the easiest option
Published Date: but here's the reality: ignoring debt might offer temporary relief
